description:
Overview of metrics from Prometheus 2.0.  
Useful for using prometheus to monitor your prometheus.
Revisions welcome!

panels.description: Total number of appended samples at proemtheus start to now
panels.title: Total samples

panels.description:
Total number of appended samples. It is possible to achieve compression of 1.3 bytes per sample in production, but prefer to be conservative with 2 bytes per sample when estimating. The default retention period is 15 days, so 100,000 samples per second over 15 days is approximately 240GB. The next question is how much RAM do you need? The storage works in blocks that are written out every two hours and then compressed into larger time frames. The storage engine does not cache internally, but uses the kernel's page cache. So you need enough RAM to hold the chunks, plus the overhead, and the ones used during the query.
Hourly sample uptake is a good starting point, so 100,000 samples per second is approximately 8GB.
panels.title: Scrape Samples per sec
